summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 discussing scheduling a call regarding the Epstein case in the Southern District of New York (SDNY). It involves coordination between a prosecutor and defense attorneys, indicating ongoing legal discussions and strategy.

persons.name: Daniel J. Kaiser
persons.context: Attorney at Kaiser Saurborn & Mair, P.C., involved in discussions regarding the Epstein case. He is coordinating call times with prosecutors and other attorneys.

persons.name: Kimberly Lerner
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email chain, involved in scheduling a call about the Epstein case. She mentions being at a charity function.

persons.name: William H. Kaiser
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email chain, involved in the Epstein case discussions.

persons.name: Brad
persons.context: Attorney referenced as being out of the country but available to talk the following week regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Stan
persons.context: Attorney referenced as also representing a client in the Epstein case but who wouldn't ordinarily be the primary contact.

persons.name: Dan
persons.context: Likely a reference to Daniel J. Kaiser, mentioned in the context of requesting a call.

The email chain shows coordination between defense attorney Kaiser and a federal prosecutor from the SDNY regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduling of Epstein case call

keyFacts: The document shows active legal coordination between defense attorneys and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the Epstein case in July 2019.
Multiple attorneys (Daniel J. Kaiser, Kimberly Lerner, William H. Kaiser, Brad, Stan) are involved in representing a client (likely a witness or associate) in the Epstein case.
The correspondence indicates a prior meeting between the legal teams had taken place, suggesting ongoing cooperation or negotiation.
The timing (July 2019) is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in New York on July 6, 2019, indicating early stages of the federal prosecution.
